actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Immigration, Refugees, and International Law.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Immigration, Refugees, and International Law

official_title: Expressing the sense of the House of Representatives that the House Judiciary Committee should hold hearings for the purpose of evaluating all evidence relative to the Arthur Rudolph case and upon conclusion of such investigation determine whether the Office of Special Investigation of the Department of Justice was justified in its actions or violated the rights of Arthur Rudolph.

summary.text: Expresses the sense of the House of Representatives that the House Committee on the Judiciary should hold hearings to evaluate all related evidence to the Arthur Rudolph (alleged Nazi war criminal) case and determine if the Office of Special Investigation of the Department of Justice violated Mr. Rudolph's rights.

titles.title: Expressing the sense of the House of Representatives that the House Judiciary Committee should hold hearings for the purpose of evaluating all evidence relative to the Arthur Rudolph case and upon conclusion of such investigation determine whether the Office of Special Investigation of the Department of Justice was justified in its actions or violated the rights of Arthur Rudolph.
